Key Match Events: James Rodriguez will start and captain the side after getting 45 minutes under his belt.
Luis Diaz scored the equaliser on Friday after entering the break with three goals and an assist in his first three Premier League games of the season.
Argentina are unbeaten in 13 away qualifiers dating back to a defeat in the altitude of Bolivia seven years ago.
Pre-Game Insights: It is usually close between these two nations, with extra time needed in the recent Copa final, and penalties in the 2021 edition, while they drew 2-2 in their last meeting on Colombian soil.
Colombia have only won one of the last 13 meetings, though, with many ending in stalemates, and Argentina's strong away form suggests another draw could be on the cards.
Colombia welcome pace-setters Argentina to Barranquilla in South American World Cup qualifying on Tuesday night.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Colombia are without two of their most experienced players for this squad, as veteran goalkeeper David Ospina and Davinson Sanchez are both sidelined with injury.
Argentina are without Lionel Messi as he continues to recover from the ankle injury that forced him in off in the Copa final back in July against their upcoming opponents.
Others: Colombia possible starting lineup: Vargas; Munoz, Lucumi, Mina, Mojica; Rios, Lerma, Arias; James, Duran, Diaz
Argentina possible starting lineup: E. Martinez; Molina, Otamendi, Romero, Li. Martinez; De Paul, Mac Allister, Fernandez, Lo Celso; Alvarez, La. Martinez
